description: This event is recorded when a user manually switches to a different IAM role within the AWS Management Console.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: The SwitchRole API call indicates that a user is leveraging valid credentials to access different roles, which could be used for maintaining persistence, evading detection, or moving laterally within the AWS environment.
Switching to a role with higher privileges could be an attempt to escalate privileges within the AWS environment.

By switching to a role with sufficient privileges, an attacker could disable or modify security controls such as CloudTrail logging, thus impairing the defenses in place to detect and respond to malicious activities.
The use of SwitchRole can be a tactic to manipulate IAM roles and associated policies, thus enabling or disabling certain permissions or roles.
The API call might be used to masquerade as a different user or role, enabling an attacker to carry out malicious activities under the guise of a legitimate user.

securityImplications: Attackers might use SwitchRole when using the console to escalate privileges and gain unauthorized access to AWS resources.
